STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 29, 2025
CHELSEA LYNN TUCKER
PATHWAYS OF ARBOR CIRCLE
412 CENTURY LN,
HOLLAND, MI, 49423-4285
Re: License #: CB700201042
Dear CHELSEA LYNN TUCKER:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
5/19-5/23/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement
• (2) The foster parent/agency agreement must
contain all the following provisions:
• (f) The agency schedule of foster care
payments to foster parents.
Five of Six files of foster homes reviewed (2 agency homes & 3 borrowed beds)
contained foster parent/agency agreements that did not include the agency's
schedule of payments to foster parents.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• When accepting a case transfer from another agency, ensure all
documentation of medicals completed prior to case transferred are obtained and
uploaded.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was neither requested nor required.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with that CAP is as follows: The one CAP
submitted by the agency during the period under review was written in response to
the 2024 licensing inspection. That CAP addressed 11 violations, 2 of which were
policy requirements no longer regulated by DCWL. The remaining 9 violations
were related to licensing rule requirements all of which were sufficiently addressed
by the CAP as evidenced by a lack of repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment completed 5/1/2025 was reviewed and
discussed during the inspection entrance. The chief administrator identified areas
of non-compliance related directly to MDHHS policy requirements, despite there
being a high level of compliance with licensing rule requirements. The chief
administrator attributed the areas of non-compliance to staffing challenges such as
high rate of turnover and downsizing from two foster care teams to one.
Financial Overview
Reviewed the agency's income statements/budget ending 2/28/2025, financial
reports and independent auditor's report. No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
The staff interviewed described a high level of support from supervisors and the
program director. Despite there being a lot of staffing changes, the agency
supervisors have maintained consistent expectations. This has helped keep staff
on track with their caseload and task management.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency office appears to have adequate space and equipment to provide for
the delivery of foster home certification, foster care, adoption, and independent
living services. The files are stored securely in a locking file room preventing
unauthorized access. Physical CHRI is stored in a separate location within a
locked office along with the cross shredder. The file/CHRI storage viewed includes
the closed adoption files and physical CHRI from the satellite location as well as
the main location.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
May 28, 2025
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 29, 2025
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
4
